hedline.hl1: Rangel and Suozzi Clash Over Backing From Wealthy Republican

abstract.p: New York Democratic Rep Charles B Rangel criticizes gubernatorial hopeful Thomas R Suozzi over accepting contributions from Kenneth G Langone, wealthy Republican who opposes Democrats in Congress; Rangel supports Suozzi rival Eliot Spitzer for governor (M)

block.p: A leading Democrat in the New York Congressional delegation yesterday criticized Thomas R. Suozzi, a Democratic candidate for governor, faulting his association with a wealthy Republican benefactor who opposes Democrats in Washington.

The Congressional leader, Representative Charles B. Rangel, said that Mr. Suozzi should return the thousands of dollars he has received from the supporter, Kenneth G. Langone, a co-founder of Home Depot.

A leading Democrat in the New York Congressional delegation yesterday criticized Thomas R. Suozzi, a Democratic candidate for governor, faulting his association with a wealthy Republican benefactor who opposes Democrats in Washington.

The Congressional leader, Representative Charles B. Rangel, said that Mr. Suozzi should return the thousands of dollars he has received from the supporter, Kenneth G. Langone, a co-founder of Home Depot.

''Some of us believe that the Republican Party has taken our state of New York, as well as our nation, in the wrong direction,'' Mr. Rangel wrote in a letter to Mr. Suozzi, which was also distributed to reporters. ''I certainly thought that you were one of us.''
Mr. Suozzi retorted just hours later, saying that he was a loyal Democrat and that he and Mr. Langone ''fundamentally disagree on this issue.''
''I am a proud lifelong Democrat who fervently believes in taking back the Congress for our party,'' Mr. Suozzi wrote in response to Mr. Rangel.
Mr. Rangel has endorsed Eliot Spitzer, the attorney general, in the governor's race. Mr. Spitzer has received the support of most Democratic elected officials statewide.

Mr. Langone, a former chairman of the New York Stock Exchange compensation committee, has been one of the subjects of a civil suit from Mr. Spitzer's office over pay for a top executive. Mr. Langone has promised considerable financial backing to Mr. Suozzi in the campaign.
At a fund-raiser this week for former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani, Mr. Langone spoke of the need to keep Republicans in power in Washington, in the House and the Senate.
''This is a critical time,'' Mr. Langone said. ''It's not a time to turn the asylum over to the inmates.''
In his response letter, Mr. Suozzi pointed out several issues where he said Mr. Rangel and Mr. Spitzer had parted ways.
''Eliot Spitzer supported the Iraq war, which you opposed,'' Mr. Suozzi wrote. ''Eliot Spitzer supports the death penalty, which you do not.''
